oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Postcard, Third Regiment, 1907
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: James E. Thompson, Photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Unused postcard. "Third Regiment N.G.S.T. Band and Baker-Himel students, passing Courthouse. Baker-Himel school stood 96 dry and 4 wet." Shows crowd watching band, Baker-Himel sign. Frank Carpenter Stable sign on building, ruins of Women's Building, and Magnolia streetcar also pictured. Handwritten note: "You will see the ruins of a fire in this picture. It was the Women's Building Since rebuilt." JET logo (James E. Thomson, Photographer) at lower left. #3 at lower right. [Knoxville's Great Temperance Election of March 11, 1907.]
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Postcards; Voting; Temperance; Women's suffrage; Bands; Buildings; Band uniforms; Buildings; Street railroads;
